fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content: At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center the pin on your property.

fields.name: private-address
fields.prompt: Or, search by address:
fields.placeholder: Your address will never be shared

fields.name: which_watershed_header
fields.content: 2. Watershed Resource Inventory Area (WRIA)

fields.name: which_watershed
fields.prompt: Of the four WRIA regions on the map (Lower Chehalis, Upper Chehalis, Willapa and Grays-Elchoman), where is your project area primarily located?

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content: 3. Wetland areas

fields.name: wetlands_information
fields.content:
Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: Are there any wetlands? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content: 4. Frequently flooded areas

fields.name: frequently_flooded_information
fields.content:
Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: Are there any frequently flooded areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content: 5. Severe geologic hazard areas

fields.name: geologic_hazard_information
fields.content:
Description

Severe geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: Are there any severe geologic hazard areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content: 6. Critical aquifer recharge areas

fields.name: critical_aquifer_information
fields.content:
Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: Are there any critical aquifer recharge areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_header
fields.content: 7. Fish & wildlife conservation areas

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_information
fields.content:
Description

Fish & wildlife conservation areas are managed to maintain populations of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wildlife_conservation
fields.prompt: Are there any fish & wildlife conservation areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: project_type_header
fields.content: Product Produced

fields.name: which_project_type
fields.prompt: What type of project would you like to report?

fields.name: cranberries_header
fields.content:
Questions for Cranberry Producers

Questions specific to cranberry production relate to water quality control measures. For a list of potential stewardship activities specific to cranberry growers, please see:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EZ0K0yjETb5VPk2_o23YGacwQSy207XU8tJmmO3ih-U/pub

fields.name: cranberries_pesticides_herbicides
fields.content:
Pesticides, Herbicides, and Fertilizers

This section relates to the following critical areas: streams, Willapa Bay, wetlands, and critical aquifer recharge areas.

fields.name: cranberries_chemigation
fields.prompt: Do you perform annual chemigation system checks?
fields.label: Chemigation checks

fields.name: cranberries_drainage_transfer
fields.prompt: Do you implement stewardship practices to reduce nutrient, pathogen, and/or pesticide transfer to drainage?
fields.label: Drainage transfer

fields.name: cranberries_fertilization_plans
fields.prompt: Do you implement fertilization plans to minimize the use of nutrients?
fields.label: Fertilization plans

fields.name: cranberries_additional_drainage
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to your practices that limit transport of pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizers to drainages (optional)

fields.name: dairy_header
fields.content:
Questions for Livestock/Dairy Producers

Questions specific to livestock/dairy production relate to water quality control measures. For a list of potential stewardship activities specific to livestock and dairy producers, please see:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SAop6Wv8nY5YU1rXLcNxMXZ_vmj_3wuxIZZU0vQhNL0/pub

fields.name: dairy_fecal_coliform
fields.content:
Fecal Coliform and Nutrients

This section relates to the following critical areas: streams, Willapa Bay, wetlands, and critical aquifer recharge areas.

fields.name: dairy_animal_waste
fields.prompt: Do you implement stewardship practices to avoid water pollution from animal waste?
fields.label: Animal waste

fields.name: dairy_training
fields.prompt: Have you or the land manager received training in stocking rates and/or rotational grazing prior to/since 2011?
fields.label: Training

fields.name: dairy_rotational_grazing
fields.prompt: Do you implement rotational grazing practices or other measures to prevent overstocking?
fields.label: Rotational grazing

fields.name: dairy_water_surfaces
fields.prompt: Are your livestock concentration areas positioned away from surface waters?
fields.label: Water surfaces

fields.name: dairy_additional_fecal_coliform
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to your practices that limit the transport of fecal coliform and nutrients to critical areas (optional)

fields.name: dairy_riparian_management
fields.content:
Riparian Management

The following questions relate to nutrient loading as well as instream habitat conditions. This section relates to the following critical areas: streams, Willapa Bay, and wetlands.

fields.name: dairy_offstream_watering
fields.prompt: Do you provide off-stream watering access for livestock?
fields.label: Offstream watering

fields.name: dairy_stream_barriers
fields.prompt: Do you maintain barriers (vegetation, fencing, berms) to discourage livestock from entering streams?
fields.label: Stream barriers

fields.name: dairy_stream_crossings
fields.prompt: Have you improved stream crossing conditions to minimize instream disturbance?
fields.label: Stream crossings

fields.name: dairy_additional_riparian_management
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to your practices that manage riparian areas (optional)

fields.name: shellfish_header
fields.content:
Questions for Shellfish Producers

Questions specific to shellfish production relate to water quality control measures, limiting the effects of practices on adjacent habitats, and ensuring that practices do not contribute to marine debris.

For a list of potential stewardship activities specific to shellfish producers, please see:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/17bmd7fhMdS8gMXrfElDqKIcROGheSJjFqbE4MdMmlDY/pub

Additional general questions will follow.

fields.name: shellfish_npdes_consistency
fields.content:
NPDES Consistency

This section relates to Willapa Bay.

fields.name: shellfish_npdes_compliance
fields.prompt: Do you ensure compliance with NPDES permit requirements for WSDA-approved pesticide application on marine lands?
fields.label: NPDES compliance

fields.name: shellfish_npdes_permit
fields.prompt: If you have an NPDES permit for shellfish hatchery or processing activities, do you comply with NPDES permit requirements?
fields.label: NPDES permit

fields.name: shellfish_additional_npdes_compliance
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to NPDES consistency (optional)

fields.name: shellfish_mechanical_harvest
fields.content:
Mechanical harvest

This section relates to Willapa Bay.

fields.name: shellfish_mechanical_disturbance
fields.prompt: If you practice mechanical shellfish harvesting, do you implement stewardship practices to minimize disturbance to adjacent habitats?
fields.label: Mechanical disturbance

fields.name: shellfish_additional_disturbance
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to your practices to limit disturbance to adjacent habitats from mechanical harvest (optional)

fields.name: shellfish_off_bottom_harvest
fields.content:
Off-bottom harvest

This section relates to Willapa Bay.

fields.name: shellfish_off_bottom_gear
fields.prompt: If you practice off-bottom operations, do you position your gear to minimize effects to silt accretion and hydrodynamics?
fields.label: Off-bottom gear

fields.name: shellfish_additional_off_bottom
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to your practices to limit disturbance to adjacent habitats from off-bottom harvest (optional)

fields.name: shellfish_marine_debris
fields.content:
Marine Debris

This section relates to Willapa Bay.

fields.name: shellfish_tidelands_gear
fields.prompt: Do you remove all gear from tidelands when not in use?
fields.label: Tidelands gear

fields.name: shellfish_longline_rope
fields.prompt: Do you engage in practices to keep longline rope from becoming debris?
fields.label: Longline rope

fields.name: shellfish_additional_debris_management
fields.prompt: Please provide additional comments related to your practices to managing debris (optional)

fields.name: almost_done
fields.content:
14. Almost Completed!

This page will determine how your information is shared. We will report all practices at the watershed analysis unit scale, but if you are interested in having your project showcased you can give us permission below. Either way, we will be using your stewardship practice to capture how agriculture is protecting and/or restoring critical areas and maintaining the viability of agriculture.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: Show your stewardship practices! Upload photos before, during, or after you implemented your stewardship practices:
fields.label: Upload photos

fields.name: share_photos
fields.prompt: Can the Pacific Conservervation District highlight your photos in our current media platforms?

content.label: No, Share my project information with Pacific Conservation District only.
Id like more information. (For more information, contact PCD @ (360) 875-6735)

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public? (Checking "yes" below will place a pin on the map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be visible to the public.)

content.label: Yes (Checking "yes" will place a pin on this map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be published.)
No, share my project information with Pacific Conservation District only.
No, I'd like more information (For more information, contact PCD @ (360) 875-6735)

fields.name: contact_interest
fields.prompt: Would you like to be contacted about potential project ideas?

content:
Welcome Pacific Conservation District!

Get Started

The Pacific Conservation District utilizes many local, state and federal resources to fund and manage the implementation of natural resource projects throughout our district boundary and we know that many of our local landowners are doing the same!

To better share our communitys stewardship story PCD has put this mapping / survey tool together where stewards can share as much or as little about their efforts as they would like. We encourage you to share your stewardship and we thank you!
